title: Manager, Corporate Workforce Solutions (2025-497-CP)
description:
Competition # 2025-497-CPManager, Corporate Workforce Solutions (2025-497-CP)Employment Type:Contract Salary (12 months), (Non) Bargaining Unit  Work Hours:35 hours/week (M-F 9am-5pm)Work Setting:Hybrid – Opportunity to work remotely after orientation & training periodSalary:$65,000 - $75,000Application Deadline:December 11, 2025, by 11:59 pm
Who We Are
WoodGreen is a team of diverse and innovative change makers working together to make a difference in our  communities.  A United Way Anchor Agency with a proven track record and an entrepreneurial mindset, we continuously seek to develop solutions to critical social needs while striving to become a Centre for Equity.
Visit www.woodgreen.org to learn more about who we are and to review our Equity Statement.We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve. We encourage, and are pleased to consider, applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women/women identifying, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions.
Program Overview – Community Programs Unit, Workforce Development

The Manager, Corporate Workforce Solutions plays a central role in strengthening employment outcomes for WoodGreen clients by coordinating internal workforce solutions related programming efforts, leveraging employer feedback, and enhancing client readiness for sustainable employment.

This position focuses on operational excellence and collaboration ensuring that hiring events, pre-screening activities, client training, mentorship opportunities, and feedback loops are effectively aligned to support job seeker success. The Manager leads the coordination of hiring events, client preparation sessions, and skills-based workshops, translating employer insights into structured readiness frameworks that help job seekers achieve long-term success.

The role works closely and collaboratively with the Managers of Integrated Employment Services, Managers of Workforce Solutions, Employment Consultants, Job Developers, and the Career Success Coaches (retention team) to ensure a unified approach to client preparation, event coordination, and post-placement support.


What You Will Do
 * Lead the coordination of large-scale and sector-focused hiring initiatives, ensuring all internal teams are aligned in planning, candidate preparation, client training, hiring events and post-event evaluation to improve client employment outcomes.
 * Facilitate collaboration across departments to consolidate and manage candidate pipelines, integrating standardized pre-screening frameworks that enhance job readiness and consistency in candidate quality.
 * Translate employer feedback from hiring events, mentorship programs, and follow-ups into actionable process improvements that strengthen training, readiness frameworks, and employer satisfaction.
 * Develop structured systems for capturing, analyzing, and reporting hiring event data, including candidate conversions, retention, and quality outcomes, ensuring these insights inform future program design.
 * Coordinate internal client readiness activities, including skills training workshops, mock interviews, and mentorship sessions, ensuring clients are well-prepared for employer interactions and job placements.
 * Ensure continuous alignment between workforce programs and employer expectations by maintaining clear communication channels across departments and integrating feedback into service delivery.
 * Collaborate with internal teams to ensure that employer partnerships are sustained beyond events, contributing to long-term workforce development goals and integrated volunteer or mentorship pathways.
 * Maintain all activities in the CRM and other tools to actively develop and track action plans for ongoing and upcoming initiatives.

Corporate Hiring & Relationship Management
 * Manage end-to-end hiring event coordination, ensuring employers receive a curated, pre-screened pool of qualified candidates.
 * Collaborate with internal job developers, employment consultants, and training teams to align candidate readiness with employer expectations.
 * Develop and maintain a feedback framework to improve candidate quality, hiring timelines, and overall employer satisfaction.
 * Maintain ongoing engagement with employer champions and industry partners to identify emerging workforce needs.

Corporate Volunteering & Community Engagement
 * Implement and coordinate corporate volunteering activities for key employer accounts identified by the Foundation team.
 * Engage continuously with operational teams to understand their needs and design volunteering opportunities that support those initiatives.
 * Screen, match, and coordinate volunteers to ensure suitable placement and effective participation in identified activities.
 * Maintain and update databases and records related to corporate volunteering activities, participation, and outcomes.

Mentorship Ecosystem & Job Seeker Empowerment
 * Design and implement a centralized mentorship framework connecting job seekers from multiple WoodGreen programs with professionals across various industries.
 * Identify and manage partnerships with mentorship platforms, networks, and employer-led programs.
 * Coordinate mentorship integration across internal programs, ensuring youth, newcomers, and trades participants receive equitable access to mentorship opportunities.
 * Establish recognition systems for mentors and corporate partners contributing to workforce development.

General Responsibilities
 * Ensure the anti-racism objectives and community development principles of the organization are achieved within the programs.
 * Work with other staff to ensure ongoing collaboration and coordination within the unit and the organization.
 * Contribute to the achievement of WoodGreen Community Programs Unit’s wider objectives through collaboration with the management team.
 * Adhere to policies and procedures such as service standards, Collective Agreement, Privacy, Bill 168, AODA standards and other related legislations.
 * Work with partner organizations to enhance service capacity and client benefits.
 * Responsible for upgrading training and education as required by WoodGreen.

What You Bring to the Team
 * Bachelor's or master's degree major in Human Resource, Public Administration, Sales / Marketing, or a related discipline.
 * 3–5 years of progressive experience in employer engagement, workforce development, HR partnership roles, or community-based workforce programs.
 * Demonstrated success in managing end-to-end corporate relationships and coordinating hiring events or volunteer programs that deliver measurable employment outcomes.
 * Experience designing or implementing mentorship frameworks, CSR initiatives, or employer-driven talent pipelines.

What Will Set You Apart
 * Strong understanding of corporate recruitment practices, CSR/DEI objectives, and workforce trends in the Greater Toronto Area.
 * Proficient in CRM systems (such as Microsoft Dynamics, HubSpot, or Salesforce) and data-driven reporting tools for tracking employer engagement and outcomes.
 * Excellent communication, presentation, and partnership management skills with the ability to engage C-Suite, Senior HR, CSR, and Operations leaders.
 * Experience working collaboratively with multi-stakeholder teams (internal and external) to align employer needs with program objectives.
 * Strategic thinker with a strong understanding of corporate and community partnership dynamics.
 * Results-driven and able to translate employer feedback into tangible employment outcomes.
 * Strong relationship builder who can navigate complex stakeholder environments and maintain long-term partnerships.
 * Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to plan and execute sector-specific hiring events and volunteering initiatives.
 * Analytical and data-oriented mindset with attention to impact measurement and continuous improvement.
 * Collaborative, empathetic, and adaptable leader capable of working in a fast-paced, multi-program environment.
 * Committed to equity and community empowerment through employer partnerships and inclusive workforce development.
sector: Wireless Services, Telecommunications, and Communications Equipment Manufacturing

title: Executive Assistant
description:
About TripleLift

We're TripleLift, an advertising platform on a mission to elevate digital advertising through beautiful creative, quality publishers, actionable data and smart targeting. Through over 1 trillion monthly ad transactions, we help publishers and platforms monetize their businesses. Our technology is where the world's leading brands find audiences across online video, connected television, display and native ads. Brand and enterprise customers choose us because of our innovative solutions, premium formats, and supportive experts dedicated to maximizing their performance.

As part of the Vista Equity Partners portfolio, we are NMSDC certified, qualify for diverse spending goals and are committed to economic inclusion. Find out how TripleLift raises up the programmatic ecosystem at triplelift.com.

Role

TripleLift is looking for a highly organized, proactive, and entrepreneurial Executive Assistant to support our leadership team. This role requires a passion for operational excellence and process improvement, particularly those involving cross-functional collaboration and automation. The ideal candidate will excel at managing intricate schedules, coordinating communications, and ensuring the seamless operation of the executive office. As a trusted and resourceful partner, you will demonstrate initiative and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on maximizing executive productivity.

You will collaborate extensively with teams across TripleLift, including Finance, IT, Security, Revenue, Marketing, Legal, Engineering, and Product. You will also work alongside a team of Executive Assistants supporting other executives, partnering to achieve company goals. If you are a collaborative, solutions-oriented individual who can think on your feet, communicate effectively, and implement best practices to drive results, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities


 * Meeting & Calendar Management: Oversee all aspects of meeting coordination (scheduling, logistics, communication, preparation for various meeting types) and proactively manage the executive's calendar, resolving conflicts through collaboration with other assistants.
 * Senior Stakeholder Communication: Communicate directly with senior client contacts, investors and partners with the highest level of professionalism.
 * Financial Administration & Budget Support: Process and code invoices/expenses, maintain financial records, and assist with managing team travel/expense budgets, procurement, and overall department budget.
 * Document & Communication Management: Prepare high-quality documents (presentations, minutes, agendas), proactively manage and organize sensitive business documents (contracts, reports, correspondence) with accuracy and confidentiality. Act as the main point of contact for internal and external stakeholders.
 * Team Engagement Support: Provide logistical planning and support for team events (all-hands meetings, celebrations), including bookings, agendas, and budget oversight.
 * Cross-Functional Collaboration & Project Participation: Build and maintain strong working relationships across departments and manage or contribute to special projects to support business goals.
 * Confidentiality: Handle sensitive information with utmost confidentiality and discretion.
   
   
   

Desired Skills And Experience


 * Previous experience in a fast-paced administrative or support role, with a desire to transition into a broader operations function.
 * Bachelor's degree in business administration or a related field (or equivalent experience).
 * Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects effectively in a dynamic environment, with a proactive approach to execution.
 * Entrepreneurial mindset with a proven track record of identifying needs, resolving issues, anticipating challenges, and developing solutions.
 * Strong work ethic and experience collaborating across global teams to manage multiple tasks and establish priorities.
 * Proficiency in utilizing AI tools to improve efficiency and streamline administrative processes, with a forward-thinking approach to adopting innovative solutions for enhanced team productivity.
 * Experience with various technology tools and processes.
 * Proactive and resilient in handling pressure, managing strict deadlines, and adapting to rapidly changing environments.
 * Flexibility to adapt to evolving demands and environments while maintaining a high level of professionalism.
 * Exceptional organizational skills with a strong attention to detail.
 * Proven ability to adapt and refine communication, both written and verbal.
 * Capacity and willingness to work independently as well as collaboratively within a growing team.
   
   
   

Ideal Candidate Profile


 * Proven experience in a high-speed administrative or support role, with the ability to proactively manage and prioritize numerous projects in a fast-moving setting.
 * Proven Executive Assistant experience with a strong desire to expand impact and contribute to broader operational initiatives.
 * Bachelor's degree in business administration or a related area (or equivalent practical experience).
 * Entrepreneurial spirit with a history of identifying needs, solving problems, and anticipating issues to develop solutions, coupled with a strong work ethic and experience collaborating across global teams to manage tasks and set priorities.
 * Proficient in using AI tools and various other technology tools and processes to boost efficiency and streamline administrative workflows, with a focus on adopting new technologies to improve team productivity.
 * Proactive and resilient under pressure, capable of meeting tight deadlines and adapting to rapid changes and evolving demands while maintaining a professional demeanor.
 * Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail, with a proven ability to adapt and refine both written and verbal communication and the capacity to work both independently and collaboratively within a growing team.
   
   
   

Additional Valued Skills And Experience


 * Experience working in a technology and/or advertising technology environment
 * Certified Project Management experience (e.g. Agile or Prince2)
 * Team player with a positive attitude, coupled with the ability to work independently and show initiative.
 * Experience in data analysis and budget management
 * Consulting experience, with a focus on operations management
   
   
   

Life at TripleLift

At TripleLift, we’re a team of great people who like who they work with and want to make everyone around them better. This means being positive, collaborative, and compassionate. We hustle harder than the competition and are continuously innovating.

Learn more about TripleLift and our culture by visiting our LinkedIn Life page.

Establishing People, Culture and Community Initiatives

At TripleLift, we are committed to building a culture where people feel connected, supported, and empowered to do their best work. We invest in our people and foster a workplace that encourages curiosity, celebrates shared values, and promotes meaningful connections across teams and communities. We want to ensure the best talent of every background, viewpoint, and experience has an opportunity to be hired, belong, and develop at TripleLift. Through our People, Culture, and Community initiatives, we aim to create an environment where everyone can thrive and feel a true sense of belonging.

Privacy Policy

Please see our Privacy Policies on our TripleLift and 1plusX websites.

TripleLift does not accept unsolicited resumes from any type of recruitment search firm. Any resume submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of TripleLift and no fee shall be due.

title: Technical Program Manager
description:
Make a difference here.
UltraViolet Cyber is a leading platform-enabled unified security operations company providing a comprehensive suite of security operations solutions. Founded and operated by security practitioners with decades of experience, the UltraViolet Cyber security-as-code platform combines technology innovation and human expertise to make advanced real-time cybersecurity accessible for all organizations by eliminating risks of separate red and blue teams.

By creating continuously optimized identification, detection, and resilience from today’s dynamic threat landscape, UltraViolet Cyber provides both managed and custom-tailored unified security operations solutions to the Fortune 500, Federal Government, and Commercial clients. UltraViolet Cyber is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with global offices across the U.S. and in India.

The Technical Program Manager will be part of a Key Personnel team in support of DHS customer of UltraViolet's.

What You'll Do:


 * Provide a full development life cycle program to provide, but not limited to, project management, budget operations, strategic development, and tracking.
 * Use technical background to implement technology strategies and ensure effective delivery
 * Lead a team of network engineers and architects in supporting DHS
 * Knowledge of various Cloud Service Provider Offerings,
 * Developing roadmaps, implementing best practices, and designing repeatable processes.
 * Manage assessment of network tools, gather user requirements, define modules missing, determining the product advantages and disadvantages
 * Assisting and providing insight to DHS to ensure stewardship is accomplished and maintained
 * Identify and resolve risks, issues and dependencies
 * Identify internal and external dependencies
 * Perform research and development including and not limited to bake offs on products.
 * Update project information on the various SharePoint/JIRA/Confluence sites
 * Provide weekly status reports on the projects progress
 * Provide monthly invoices to include a summary page itemizing costs at the project level Program Management Report (PMR) monthly
   
   
   
   
   

What You've Done:


 * US Citizenship Required
 * Ability to pass DHS EOD & Suitability
 * 15 years experience leading programs supporting network systems and infrastructure
 * with over 5,500 field sites, 2 or more datacenters/colocation facilities, and 250,000+ users.
 * Master Degree
 * Project Management Professional (PNP) certification - Active
 * Certified Cisco Network Professional (CCNP) certification - Active
 * ITILv4 certification - Active
 * Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) certification - Active
 * Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification – Active
   
   
   
   
   

Preferred qualifications:



 * 15+ years supporting DHS LAN/WAN
 * 10+ years supporting DHS System ATO and C&A activities
 * Experience supporting DHS St. Elizabeth Campus network
 * Experience leading network modernization projects for DHS
   
   
   
   
   

What We Offer:


 * 401(k), including an employer match of 100% of the first 3% contributed and 50% of the next 2% contributed
 * Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance (available on the 1st day of the month following your first day of employment)
 * Group Term Life, Short-Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability
 * Voluntary Life, Hospital Indemnity, Accident, and/or Critical Illness
 * Participation in the Discretionary Time Off (DTO) Program
 * 11 Paid Holidays Annually
   
   
   
   
   

UltraViolet Cyber maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect our company's differing products, services, industries and lines of business. Candidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors.

We sincerely thank all applicants in advance for submitting their interest in this position. We know your time is valuable.

UltraViolet Cyber welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.
If you want to make an impact, UltraViolet Cyber is the place for you!

title: TCEQ - Data Analyst II
description:
Please paste the following URL into a browser to view the entire job posting in the CAPPS Career Section: https://capps.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobdetail.ftl?job=00054115

You may apply to the job directly through the CAPPS Career Section. It is not necessary to apply both through Work In Texas and CAPPS Career Section

Are you an experienced Data Analyst, ready for a unique opportunity to grow with an environmental state agency?Join TCEQ! We bring passion and drive to carry out our mission of protecting our stateand#8217;s public health and natural resources.YOUR FUTURE TEAMAs part of TCEQand#8217;s Office of Air, you would contribute to protecting and restoring Texasand#8217; air quality. See details about what we do. This position is a member of our Air Quality Division.HEREand#8217;S WHAT YOUand#8217;LL BE DOINGAssist with and/or conduct chemical, statistical, computer, and other functions in the collection and analysis of data to assess the relationship between emissions, meteorology and pollutant concentrations as used in State Implementation Plan (SIP) modeling.

Prepare reports and presentations for the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), the public and scientific community regarding air quality research. Present findings to the public, scientific community, and management. Conduct peer review of technical reports, presentations, and documents.

Serve as an advisor and consultant to staff and contractors in technical matters and program functions. Initiate scientific projects to be contracted out and oversees project development to completion.

Interact with local, state, and federal agencies, the regulated community, and the general public.

Qualifications: KEY QUALIFICATIONSExperience overseeing technical or scientific environmental research projects/contracts.

Experience developing technical documentation for federal or state environmental plans.

Experience communicating technical information to various audiences.

Experience retrieving (querying), reviewing, and analyzing complex data sets.REQUIRED EDUCATION EXPERIENCEFive years of full-time experience in conducting quality assurance and quality control of data, data review and reconciliation, data research, or data compilation; and/or data reporting work.ORA bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with a major in basic science, computer science, environmental studies, mathematics, statistics, or a related field; plus, one year of the required experience.ORA bachelorand#8217;s degree from an accredited college or university; plus, two years of the required experience.Employees in this classification series may research, work on, or have access to critical infrastructure, including but not limited to a communication infrastructure system, cybersecurity system, electric grid, hazardous waste treatment system, or water treatment facility. See Tex. Business Commerce Code Section 117.001(2). A copy of your official college transcript or evaluation of foreign credentials in CAPPS is required if needed to meet the qualifications listed above.CURRENT TCEQ EMPLOYEESThis position is also available as a lateral transfer opportunity (LTO) to TCEQ employees within theData Analyst II state classification. The selected candidate must meet the minimum qualifications of the corresponding job in theData Analyst II series.Work ScheduleStandard business hours are M-F, 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.Individual and work group schedule determined by the Air Quality Division.BENEFITSOptional 401(k) and 457 plans

Insurance: Health, Vision, Dental, and optional FSA

Paid day(s) off from work on national holidays and holidays that the state observes

Pr fessional development opportunities

Wellness Program and Activities

Work-Life BalanceCONDITION OF EMPLOYMENTTCEQ will conduct a criminal history records search, driving history (if required for the job) on candidates offered employment.In compliance with ADA, if you need any special accommodations during the employment process, please contact HRSS for assistance at (512) 239-0102.MILITARY OCCUPATIONAL SPECIALTY (MOS) CODESMilitary Occupational Specialty (MOS) codes can be found at:https://hr.sao.texas.gov/CompensationSystem/JobDescriptions/.Please click the hyperlink under and#8216;Occupational Categoryand#8217; for the respective Class Title.Texas Commission on Environmental Quality is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Product Manager
description:
About Chase Corporation

Founded in 1946, we have grown to become a global specialty chemicals company that is a leading manufacturer of protective materials for high-reliability applications across diverse market sectors.




Today, we employ nearly 800 people and continue to grow and strengthen our business by employing a related diversification strategy that combines organic growth initiatives with strategic acquisitions.




Based in Westwood, Massachusetts, USA, we operate manufacturing facilities in the United States, Europe, and Asia and continue to invest in our capabilities.




Role Overview

Reporting to the Director of Product, the Product Manager will be responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle of all products within the assigned industry segment. This high-impact role is responsible for managing product portfolio, developing and leading product roadmaps, guiding technical development, ensuring regulatory compliance, driving commercialization efforts, and aligning solutions with customer application needs by understanding the full customer buying journey and crafting differentiated value propositions. The ideal candidate combines technical acumen with market intelligence, strategic vision, and strong execution capabilities to champion customer-centric innovation and drive profitable growth.




Key Responsibilities

Product Strategy & Portfolio Management

Develop and execute strategic product roadmaps.

 * Monitor competitive intelligence and market trends by geography to inform strategy with insights and communication functions.
 * Continuously evaluate product offerings to ensure relevance, efficiency, productivity and profitability.

Lead product development from ideation to execution, including:

 * Identify and validate high-value customer problems and innovation opportunities.
 * Collaborate with R&D and sales to assess feasibility, prioritize features, articulate value proposition vs competition, and define clear product scope and success criteria.
 * Manage the commercialization and stage gate processes in coordination with R&D, sales, supply chain, operations and manufacturing functions.

Drive cross-functional execution of the development stage gate process

 * Partner across R&D, Operations, Sales, Legal, Supply Chain, Marketing & Pricing.
 * Ensure rigorous testing, validation, and regulatory compliance.
 * Optimize development timelines and costs without compromising quality.

Manage product lifecycles across assigned the industry segment, including:

 * Guide products through introduction, growth, maturity, and sunset phases.
 * Monitor product performance and market fit to inform lifecycle decisions.
 * Partner with supply chain, sales, and finance to adjust forecasts, inventory strategy, and profitability targets.




Product Management

Product Data Integrity & Management

 * Manage all product data, including data sheets and application guides.
 * Coordinate with legal, R&D, and marketing to ensure consistency and availability of literature.
 * Support digitization efforts by maintaining clean, structured data.

Manage product certifications and regulatory compliance

 * Ensure that products meet all applicable regulatory requirements based on the region and application.
 * Ensure that all SKUs have proper labeling, packaging, and usage instructions that align with industry and customer standards.
 * Manage trademarking processes for new products, working closely with marketing and legal teams to protect intellectual property and mitigate brand risk.




Market Research, Analysis, and Insight Utilization

 * Leverage analytics to drive continuous improvement in product portfolio performance and customer satisfaction.
 * Translate market insights, competitive intelligence, and customer feedback into actionable recommendations for product roadmap planning and optimization.




Customer Engagement and Testing

 * Design and execute field trials in partnership with application development teams to gather insights, identify potential improvements, and ensure readiness for commercialization.
 * Oversee internal and third-party material testing to confirm product compliance, durability, and performance standards.




Qualifications

 * 5+ years of experience in product development and management.
 * Proven track record of successfully managing products from concept to launch.
 * Demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and manage complex projects.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.

Preferred Qualifications

 * Experience in the global chemical industry, with a preference for manufacturing formulated products.
 * Experience in adhesives, sealants, and coatings for the building and construction or electronic chemicals is highly desirable.

Education

 * Bachelor’s degree required, Advanced degree preferred
